answers.answer: Sorry... Off Topic But How Dilated Are You?
clothes for both of you. something comfortable. overnight bag basically.

Baby: hat, socks, mittens,  bottle, pacifier, diapers wipes couple outfits (one to come home in) dont forget carseatYou: panties, phone, charger, slippers, socks, pads, nursing bra, loose fitting clothes, loose nightgown,  snacks, juice, toiletries,

Baby: one oufit, or two because you don't know how big he or she will be, socks and mittens that's all, hospital provides everything else.For you: pack at least three oufits, make sure they're comfy!!! Oh, and granny panties you will bleed & you want to feel comfy. I don't think you need to buy pads hospital will provide. Shampoo, conditoner, all that stuff, soap, tooth brush, tooth paste. And snacks!! Hospital doesn't really let you eat while you're in labor. If your having a c section it's best not to eat anyways..
I would always pack for your husband or your boyfriend if he's staying over night with you.
Idk why it said always* lmao.. I think I got distracted & now I forgot what it was suppose to say. Lmao
Bring stuff to do! Distract yourself during dilation process! Magazines and books and such! I remember being there 14 hrs with nothing to do but soak up the pain ha

Don't over pack, you'll realize you won't need half the stuff u pack.  With my first i thought i needed everything & used maybe 3 items lol This is what I will bring: (baby #3) a comfy cute maxi dress, u don't want anything constricting. A pair of underwear,  though you'll love the hospital mesh ones better I did. 2 boxers & change of clothes for hubby, phone charger,  phone, 2 onezies & socks for baby, deodarant, & a hairbrush & hair tie.
Thanks guys (: and jmb4611 I am just 1cm but being induced due to gestational diabetes
I have a hospital bag list in my journals if you'd like to take a look. Hope it helps. Good luck
@blake01 was it bcus your baby was big? n if so how much the bby weigh? Im just curious bcus i have gestational diabetes
He is only 7.5 lbs . I do take metformin to controll the diabetes though. Other than that I'm not really sure why the dr is inducing.
Like Mommikat said you really dont need alot of things the hospital provides Alot of the things you will need .. I packed alot of things and only ended up using like 4 items...

I have pre existing diabetes and im being induced at 39 weeks.  My dr told me its because at 39 weeks the baby doesn't grow anymore (even in normal pregnancy) and that most diabetics end up having still borns if they wait to much longer past 39 weeks to be born.....
Oh Ok ... I Was Wandering Because I'm Wanting To Get Induce Next Tuesday (39+3) And I'm Only 1 1/2 Cm So They Said They Don't Really Wanna Do It Unless I'm Dilated More .... Good Lick though

question: So I go in 2mrw for induction I'll be 39w2days. What all should I bring for me and baby ?
title: Hospital Bag
